Revised by Amy Lau, Archivist, to remediate oppressive language from title, finding aid title, preferred citation, and abstract.
Brooklyn Historical Society
Queens County, N.Y. enslaved people bills of sale 1978.010
0.08 Linear Feet in one folder.
1751-1793 This collection contains bills of sale for the purchase of enslaved people in Queens County, N.Y. from 1751 to 1793, prior to the abolition of slavery in New York State. Three of the six bills of sale document the purchase of enslaved people by the Wyckoff Family of Queens County, as well as John Van Wyck. A0074
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Queens County, N.Y. enslaved people bills of sale, 1978.010, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1978.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to users without restriction.
Processing Information
Oppressive descriptive language was remediated from the title, finding aid title, preferred citation, and abstract in this finding aid as part of an anti-racist descriptive language audit performed in December 2020. The title of the related accession, EAD ID and location were not remediated.
